abstract: Bahamian man Alonzo Knowles pleads guilty to charges that he hacked into email accounts of celebrities and others and gained access to trove of unreleased movie and television scripts, which he then tried to sell to undercover agent in New York City; charges include identity theft and criminal copyright infringement.

headline.print_headline: Man Accused of Breaching Stars’ Emails Pleads Guilty
headline.main: Hacker Who Stole IDs and Scripts From Celebrities Pleads Guilty

snippet: Alonzo Knowles, 24, was arrested in December after he tried to sell unreleased scripts and the Social Security numbers of three professional athletes and a movie actress to an undercover agent.
lead_paragraph: Alonzo Knowles, 24, was arrested in December after he tried to sell unreleased scripts and the Social Security numbers of three professional athletes and a movie actress to an undercover agent.
